content.div:
For weeks, we've known Justin Bieber shares one important thing with countless Canadians (his undying love of Swiss Chalet notwithstanding). Biebz is a huge fan of Carly Rae Jespen's hit, "Call Me Maybe." After Bieber Tweeted about how much he loves the frothy pop track (currently the No. 3 song on Canadian iTunes), the pop star's manager, Scooter Braun, signed the Vancouver singer-songwriter to his label, Schoolboy Records. And he's done this 26-year-old Canadian Idol alum one further solid -- recording a new music video for "Call Me Maybe."

Apparently shot on somebody's webcam, the production quality might leave something to be desired -- especially compared to Jepsen's cutesy original. But then, this is 2012. Just adding Bieber makes for instant cinematic magic. That the DIY clip also happens to feature Selena Gomez, High School Musical's Ashley Tisdale -- and members of Boys Like Girls and Big Time Rush is just tween-baiting gravy. (Random thought: real gravy is probably not an effective way of baiting tweens. Unless it's been thrown on Justin Bieber.)

We've posted the video below -- which was uploaded to YouTube by Big Time Rush's Carlos Pena (look for him in the video. He's one of about a half-dozen teen stars lip syncing to the track), before being tweeted by Bieber.

Jepsen's EP, Curiosity, arrived Feb. 14, with a full album reportedly expected within the year. And according to the Juno nominee's Twitter, Jepsen was working with Bieber and others in L.A. this week. As she wrote yesterday, "In the studio with @justinbieber. Listening to his new stuff and it's blowing my mind."

Watch Justin Bieber and Selena Gomez's "Call Me Maybe" lip dub below.

(For more, check out our interview with Carly Rae Jepsen.)

leahc@dose.ca

link.title: Trust Issues

link.Abstract: Drake loves sweaters, but does he know how to "Take Care" of them? We've rounded up sweater-care tips that should make the Toronto MC proud.
link.title: Take Care of Your Sweaters -- With Drake!

link.Abstract: Google Music is here, and the new music service launched with a party in L.A. Nov. 16. Check out photos of Drake, Maroon 5 and Busta Rhymes performing at the Mr. Brainwash studio.

link.Abstract: Hey, ladies -- particularly those of you with nail polish and fragrance lines -- Drake has a message for you: "Make Me Proud."
link.title: Listen: Drake Debuts 'Make Me Proud'

link.Abstract: Drake's Club Paradise tour will launch Feb. 14 in Miami. He'll travel through the U.S. and Europe, but the Toronto boy's 2012 itinerary doesn't include any Canadian stops.
link.title: Drake Reveals Club Paradise Tour Dates

link.Abstract: Drake shared a new song off Take Care, "The Motto feat. Lil Wayne." Hear it here.
link.title: Hear Drake's 'Motto' (It Doesn't Involve Anything About Sweaters)

link.Abstract: How do you hold a moonbeam in your hand? You can't! And yet, Justin Bieber tries and tries and tries again. We've rounded up photos of the pop star's signature move -- the '90s boy-band air grab. Swoon!
link.title: Gallery: Justin Bieber's Signature Move

link.Abstract: Justin Bieber isn't the first, and he isn't even the youngest. Check out some of our favourite examples of celebs who've dabbled in hip-hop.
link.title: Gallery: Part-Time Rappers

entry.content: Watch Justin Bieber and Mariah Carey in their new video, "All I Want For Christmas Is You." Fair warning: Just like any other Xmas gift, you can't give this one back.

source.title: Justin Bieber, Selena Gomez and More Star in Carly Rae Jepsen Video
source.subtitle: Justin Bieber is a huge Carly Rae Jepsen fan. This much we knew. But check out the video Bieber, Selena Gomez and more made to the Vancouver pop singer's hit "Call Me Maybe."

link.title: Justin Bieber, Selena Gomez and More Star in Carly Rae Jepsen Video
Justin Bieber, Selena Gomez and More Star in Carly Rae Jepsen Video

entry.title: Listen: Justin Bieber Debuts New Song 'Be Alright' in Toronto

link.Abstract: Justin Bieber performed a new song called "Be Alright" during his Dec. 21 concert at Toronto's Massey Hall.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Justin Bieber in concert at Toronto's Massey Hall, Dec. 21, 2011. The show was taped for a MuchMusic special, Justin Bieber: Home for the Holidays, premiering Thursday, Dec.22 at 6 p.m. ET/PT on MuchMusic and 7:30 p.m. ET/PT on CTV.
link.title: Justin Bieber

link.Abstract: It's a Nov. 23 miracle! Justin Bieber performed a concert of festive hits for The Today Show. Check out pictures of our favourite Christmas Elf and his special helper, Usher.
link.title: Photos: Justin Bieber Brings a Little Christmas to The Today Show

link.Abstract: Justin Bieber says his mom "always told me there wasn't a Santa."
link.title: The Saddest Christmas Story Ever: Santa Claus Never Visited Justin Bieber

link.Abstract: Drake invited Justin Bieber to join him on "Trust Issues" during a concert this weekend in L.A. Watch the video.
link.title: Video: Drake and Justin Bieber Perform 'Trust Issues' in L.A., Reveal New Collaboration

link.Abstract: A second Justin Bieber's "Santa Claus is Coming to Town" has arrived. Watch it here -- if only to puzzle over why the kid plays a cyborg, steampunk elf.
link.title: Justin Bieber Debuts (Another) Video For 'Santa Claus Is Coming to Town'

link.Abstract: Watch Justin Bieber and Mariah Carey in their new video, "All I Want For Christmas Is You." Fair warning: Just like any other Xmas gift, you can't give this one back.
link.title: Video: Justin Bieber and Mariah Carey Debut 'All I Want For Christmas,' The Gift That Keeps On Giving You Nightmares

link.Abstract: Justin Bieber frolics with the characters from Santa Claus in Comin' to Town in his latest video. Watch it here.
link.title: Justin Bieber More Elfin Than Usual in New 'Santa Claus is Coming to Town' Video

link.Abstract: Justin Bieber recruited Boyz II Men for his latest Christmas video, "Fa La La." Watch it here.
link.title: Video: Justin Bieber and Boyz II Men Have a Very '90s Christmas

link.Abstract: How do you hold a moonbeam in your hand? You can't! And yet, Justin Bieber tries and tries and tries again. We've rounded up photos of the pop star's signature move -- the '90s boy-band air grab. Swoon!
link.title: Gallery: Justin Bieber's Signature Move

link.Abstract: MuchMusic scored a holiday miracle when it convinced Stratford, Ont.’s Justin Bieber to come home for the holidays. It scored another when it managed to book Toronto’s historic Massey Hall — one of the city’s best-sounding venues known for classic live albums by Neil Young and Rush — for the special event.
link.title: TV Tonight: Justin Bieber - Home for the Holidays
